home.home-text: Flip Inverted ArtsAcademy is one of the first academies to bring recreational gymnastics for kids and adults to Egypt. Flip’s founder, Julia Alexan, is certified by USA Gymnastics and brings in many new concepts on how to teach and train gymnastics, different from what is typically found in Egypt. At Flip, we believe that you can instill athletics in kids at a young age through gymnastics by building their progress in a fun and friendly way that leaves them loving the sport, and it will leave a long-lasting positive effect on their lifelong concept of gymnastics, fitness and sports in general.
home.classes-description: Our programs build self-confidence, determination and dedication in addition to strength, flexibility coordination and balance required to be a great gymnast.
home.events-description: We have three annual events. Our Spring Show, Winter Meet Games and Summer Show are end-of-season performances for everyone to show off the skills learned throughout the year.
home.schedules-description: Our Gymnastics Program is open in Maadi, Zamalek, 6 October, New Cairo and Sheikh Zayed, with classes offered 2-3 days per week, ongoing all year round.

contact-section.title: Start Your Flippin' Journey Today!
contact-section.text: Ask us about our classes, events, or locations and we'll be happy to help you find the perfect class for you.

classes.classes-text: We specialize in classes for ages 2.5–14, as well as juniors and adults. Our signature non-competitive gymnastics and parkour programs guide kids from Toddlers and Level 1 through Level 6 in a fun, progressive environment. For juniors and adults, we offer handstand training, adult gymnastics, and parkour—helping you build strength, flexibility, and skills like flips, splits, and bridges at any age.  Non-competitive gymnastics is similar to tumbling, or the floor apparatus in artistic gymnastics.
classes.about-kids-classes-text: Build their confidence, develop strength and keep them stretchy as we build tricks upon tricks. The real fun starts when they learn to flip in level 4..after that, the sky's the limit!  We'll keep teaching as long as they keep learning!
classes.about-adults-classes-text: Juniors and adults aim to get as far as possible on our Parkour and Handstand programs.  Private lessons are also availble.

kids-1.title: Gymnastics Level 1
kids-1.description: Learn front rolls, basic jumps and build strength for handstands and more.

image-1.title: Splits
image-1.description: They'll slowly increase their flexibility they'll need for great asthetics in their tricks.

image-2.title: Build Strength & Flexilibity
image-2.description: Building a good base of stregth and flexibility will make upstream tricks much easier for them.

image-3.title: Basic Gymnastics Shapes
image-3.description: The shapes learned in this level are the basic building blocks of all gymnastics shapes they'll use in the higher levels.

image-4.title: Bridges
image-4.description: A good, clean bridge is so important in gymnastics, as many other tricks depend on it.

kids-2.title: Gymnastics Level 2
kids-2.description: Strengthen handstand holds and learn cartwheels, front and back walkovers.

image-1.title: Bridge Holds
image-1.description: Once we've built up their endurance in longer holds in bridge, they'll be able to walk, hop, kick in bridge and more.

image-2.title: Safe Stretches
image-2.description: Without adding force or extra unneccesary pressure, safely stretch to relax the muscles at the end of training.

image-3.title: Back Flexibility
image-3.description: Increasing back flexibility one step further makes front and back walkovers that much easier for them to acheive.

image-4.title: Building Community
image-4.description: Make new friends at one of our funnest Halloween dress-up events, where our whole practice is in costume!

kids-3.title: Gymnastics Level 3 - 4
kids-3.description: With increased strength and flexibilty, your child will be ready to flip.

image-1.title: Advanced Flexiblity
image-1.description: Being dedicated to flexibility required for gymnastics opens up new moves like the needle and catching your leg.

image-2.title: Challenging the Basics
image-2.description: After holding, walking, and hopping in bridge, learn how to jump in and out of it.

image-3.title: Beginning Flips
image-3.description: Backhandspring and Fronthandspring are the first flips that open the way up to level 4.

image-4.title: Aerial Flips
image-4.description: Front and back aerials come next in Level 5.

kids-4.title: Boys Gymnastics
kids-4.description: Our boys program requires persistance to learn bars, rings and floor routines.

image-1.title: Rings
image-1.description: Learn swings and build stregnth for holds on the rings.

image-2.title: Parallel Bars
image-2.description: Build up their upper body and core with pull-up holds, support walks and hanging tuck and pike holds on the p-bars.

image-3.title: Handstand Alignment
image-3.description: Use different handstand shapes to help them build awareness of their alignment.

image-4.title: Parallettes
image-4.description: Compression exersizes build core strength in pike position.

kids-5.title: Parkour
kids-5.description: Precision, rolls, landing, jumping and passing through obstacles with style.

image-1.title: Jumps
image-1.description: Precision jumps teach them how to aim and land their jumps properly.

image-2.title: Vaults
image-2.description: Learn dash, speed, monkey as different ways to vault and continue your run.

image-3.title: Speed Run
image-3.description: This is one of the funnest challenges where you can try to beat your time or someone else's best time to see how long it takes for you to pass through all the obstacles in front of you on your run to ring the finishing bell!

image-4.title: Landing & Rolls
image-4.description: We'll teach them how to decide to land, and how to use a parkour roll to break the impact of the landing.

kids-6.title: Toddlers
kids-6.description: A guided exploration of gymnastics starts at age 2.5.

image-1.title: Learn Forward Rolls
image-1.description: Tuck and roll safely with our experienced coaches and safe environemnt.

image-2.title: Baby Handstands
image-2.description: Bunny hops turn into baby handstands as they rediscover the fun of going upside down.

image-3.title: Strength
image-3.description: They'll use the wall and a pike shape to learn their first type of handstand, a box handstand.

image-4.title: Coordination
image-4.description: Exersizing right and left parts introduces them to coordinated movement which they'll need to be graceful in gymnastics, and also in life.

adults-1.title: Handstands
adults-1.description: Start your handstand journey using drills for shapes and endurance to stay inverted longer.

image-1.title: Shapes
image-1.description: Learn fun shapes and find your balance in each one.  Then transition from one to the other.

image-2.title: Shoulder Strenth & Endurance
image-2.description: The shoulders carry your weight when standing on your hands much like the hips carrey your weight when standing right side up.  We'll build the strength and endurance you need to support your handstand.

image-3.title: Balance
image-3.description: Work with our coaches to help you use every part of your hand to find your balance upside-down.

image-4.title: Free Handstand
image-4.description: With the strength, endurance and balance that you've built, you can now stand without the wall in a free standing handstand, and join our group handstand pics! Always a blast of fun!

adults-2.title: Adult Gymnastics & Parkour
adults-2.description: Learn the basics of flips, climbing, jumping and vaulting with style.

image-1.title: Landing & Precision
image-1.description: First learn how to land with precision and stability coming out of any jump.

image-2.title: Freerunning
image-2.description: It's up to you to add your own style and spin to the flips you will learn and make them your own!

image-3.title: Strength
image-3.description: Build the strength it takes to hold your favorite gymnastics trick.

adults-3.title: Private Lessons
adults-3.description: Personalize training for your sport's requirements and focus 1-on-1 with a coach.

image-1.title: Gymnastics
image-1.description: When the focus is on you, you'll master your gymnastics trick quicker.

image-3.title: Flexibility & Mobility
image-3.description: Get to your target level of mobility & flexibility with a program that includes myofascial release, PNF stretching techniques and active and passsafe, guided method that combines light muscle engagement with stretching—to help students improve flexibility, control, and body awareness.

image-4.title: Calisthenics, Body Weight Training
image-4.description: Use your own body weight to reach the level of strength you need for your fitness goals.

image-5.title: Yoga
image-5.description: Use yoga to re-center yourself, increase your flexilibity and relax your mind at your next event.

image-6.title: Mother Daughter Training
image-6.description: You and your child might currently be in the same place on your fitness journey..or not! Customize a training plan for both of you to bond while training.

events.events-text: Be sure not to miss out on the fun at our annual events! Our Spring Show is a themed, stage show where our gymnasts perform solos and group dances to music in May/June. Our Summer Shows take place in sahel in Diplo.  At our Winter Meet Games event, everyone is welcome to join individual and team gymnastics challenges in a friendly environment where everyone wins at the end!

summer.title: Summer Show
summer.description: Sign up early to join our summer show to make the most of our summer training programs and put on an exciting show for the parents!  Registration opens in July.

winter.title: Winter Meet Games
winter.description: Our Winter Meet Games event is a great opportunity for everyone to show off the skills they've learned during training, join in some friendly challenges and have a great time! We'll have individual and team challenges and a speed run for our parkour classes.  Registration opens in September.

spring.title: Spring Shows
spring.description: Our Spring Show is our themed stage show where they dress in costume/leatord and coordinate a routine with music to perform in front of the parents. Bring them early to give them the most time to train and get a great show together!  Registration opens in February.

schedules.schedules-text: Find the closest location for you and check out our latest schedules and avilable programs.  All locations are invited to join our annual events!

common.contact-us-text: Have questions about classes? Reach out to us directly!

gezira-club-october.title: Gezira Club October
gezira-club-october.description: We currently have Toddlers (starting age 2.5), Girls and Boys gymnastics non-competitive (Flip Program) and Competitive (Aerobic Gymnastics Program) as well as Parkour for all ages and Hanstands for Adults.
gezira-club-october.form-description: Sign up to join us in GSC October Branch

gezira-club-zamalek.form-description: Sign up to join us in GSC Zamalek

zamalek-studio.description: At our exclusive gymnastics studio where we have limited spots available, we have classes for non-competitive (Flip Program) gymnastics for toddlers (starting at age 2.5) and Gymnastics for kids aged 3.5 - 12.
zamalek-studio.form-description: Sign up to join us in Zamalek Studio

maadi.title: Maadi
maadi.description: We currently have Toddlers (starting age 2.5), Girls and Boys gymnastics non-competitive (Flip Program), Parkour for all ages and Hanstands for Adults.
maadi.form-description: Sign up to join us in Maadi

sheikh-zayed.title: Sheikh Zayed
sheikh-zayed.description: Inside of Beverly Hills Compound, you'll find us currently at Garnet Gym.  We have classes for non-competitive (Flip Program) gymnastics for toddlers (starting at age 2.5) and Gymnastics for kids aged 3.5 - 12.  If you'd interested in a class not yet offered, contact us and let us know.
sheikh-zayed.form-description: Sign up to join us in Sheikh Zayed

new-cairo.title: New Cairo
new-cairo.description: In Tagamo, you'll find us currently at Aerial Grace studios.  We have classes for non-competitive (Flip Program) gymnastics for Gymnastics for kids aged 3.5 - 12.  If you'd interested in a class not yet offered, contact us and let us know.
new-cairo.form-description: Sign up to join us in New Cairo

almaza-bay.title: Almaza Bay
almaza-bay.description: Don't miss the fun of flipping on the beach! Stay tuned for our annual announcement of when we start Gymnastics at Almaza Bay in July.  We teach toddlers (starting age 2.5), non-competitive gymnastics and private lessons to help you keep up your athletes' fitness level and tricks while enjoying your summer under the sun.
almaza-bay.form-description: Sign up to join us in Almaza Bay

diplo.title: Diplo
diplo.description: Don't miss the fun of flipping on the beach! Stay tuned for our annual announcement of when we start Gymnastics in Diplo in July.  We teach toddlers (starting age 2.5), non-competitive gymnastics and private lessons to help you keep up your athletes' fitness level and tricks while enjoying your summer under the sun.
diplo.form-description: Sign up to join us in Diplo

shop.message: More flippin' fun coming soon! Thank you for your patience.

about-flip.title: A bit of Flippin' History
about-flip.subtitle: About Flip
about-flip.text: Flip Instructors are talented in motivating both kids and adults to challenge them to beat their next personal best record. Our instructors are reliable, friendly and experienced and we provide a safe environment in which you can grow, perform at your best, and feel accomplished without the stress of competition. We look forward to new challenges with new clients and we're looking forward to seeing YOU join us soon! Thanks in advance for choosing us to play an important role in you and/or your child's development!

q1.question: What if I can’t do the splits?
q1.answer: No problem!  That’s what we’re here for is to learn how to safely get just 1 cm closer, and keep progressing from there.

q2.question: I’m not flexible at all. Can I still join?
q2.answer: Of course!!  The point of the course is to increase your flexibility no matter what level you’re currently at.  So let’s work on it together!

q3.question: Am I too old to become more flexible?
q3.answer: When it comes to flexibility, your only physical limits are your bones and joints.  The muscles are what we work with to lengthen and extend to give you more room to move about your joints.  So, as long as your muscles are in normal condition, then we will be able to increase your flexibility and therefore mobility as well.  Stick to the course, follow the techniques, and you’ll get the progress you’re looking for no matter what age you are.  You can get there with dedication even if you’re over 70 years old.

q4.question: What if I have an injury?
q4.answer: If it’s a recent injury, we don’t recommend a flexibility program unless specifically prescribed to you by your doctor.  If it’s an old injury, this is the best program for you! Old injuries left unattended build scar tissues in the muscles that you need to release through direct intervention.

q5.question: What if I have a disc like a bulging or herniated disc in my spine?
q5.answer: For most cases that are not severe, this can be quite easily fixed with directed flexibility & strength. We can cover this in your personalized plan when you register for a package.

q6.question: How does flexibility help professional athletes?
q6.answer: Flexibility is a very important element to playing your sport well.  First to increase or maintain the range the motion you need for your most efficient backstroke, for example, for a swimmer; or, to hit a great forehand/backhand for a squash or tennis player; or to avoid pulling a hamstring for a soccer player kicking the ball a long distance.  And secondly, to decrease your recovery time so you can hit the court again the next day feeling fresh!  Julia has worked with Professional Men’s Women’s Squash players seated in the top 20 in the world, tennis athletes, gymnasts and professional soccer players on implementing a flexibility program to prevent injuries, increase their mobility specific to their sport, and recovering from their injuries.

q1.question: Can my child still join gymnastics with no prior training?
q1.answer: Yes, of course! We offer a recreational program that accomodates everyone at the current training level. Registration is ongoing so you can join anytime!

q1.question: What if my internet connection drops?
q1.answer: Well, for online classes, it's your responsibility to make sure you have a strong and stable internet connection before you start. There are no make up classes or refunds for online classes.

privacy-policy.title: Your Info
privacy-policy.subtitle: Privacy Policy
privacy-policy.text: Your privacy is important to us. The info you submit to us is used to find you a session most fit for you. We never share or sell your info.

safety.title: Safety
safety.subtitle: Safety
safety.text: We prioritize the safety of our kids not only through upkeep and maintenance of our equipment, , but also by taking them through proper progressions according to their current level of trainingrequiring annual training for our certified instructors.

subtitles.contact-text: We'd love to hear from you! Let us know what questions do you have.
